ETYMOLOGY: From Late Latin *identicus* (the same), from Latin *idem* (the same). First attested in the mid-17th century.

MEANINGS.PATTERN: [sth] is identical to [sth else] / [sth] are identical
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Exactly the same; alike in every respect.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 完全相同的；一模一样的；同等的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The two copies of the document were not identical; one had a spelling error.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这份文件的两份副本并不相同；其中一份有拼写错误。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective (Used before a noun, often emphasizing oneness)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The very same; one and the selfsame entity.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （强调）正是那个；完全相同的（物体或人）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She was wearing the identical dress she wore to the party last year.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她穿着和去年参加派对时一模一样的裙子。
